## Example:

Defender,

Polar bear cubs could get the protection they need to survive thanks to a new bill. Tell your elected officials to support this legislation to save these bears!
Critical habitat for polar bears is threatened by Big Oil's planned industrial invasion of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. These bears are already struggling to survive – reckless oil development could be the final nail in the coffin for the region's declining bear population.
Your representatives need to hear from you right now. Urge them to support this legislation to keep imperiled polar bears safe!

TAKE ACTION: Demand your elected officials protect vulnerable cubs by supporting the Polar Bear Cub Survival Act!

Friend of Defenders, a newborn polar bear cub only weighs about one pound. These cubs are completely dependent on their mother for nutrition and warmth. They are not strong enough to survive outside of their den.
But polar bears are in serious trouble. Many populations are in freefall: The Southern Beaufort Sea population that depends on the security of the habitat provided by the Arctic Refuge now numbers as few as 900 individuals – about half as many bears as three decades ago.
Oil exploration on the Refuge's coastal plain is a direct threat to these bears' survival. The Refuge is where pregnant mother bears go to build maternal dens and give birth. Seismic exploration for oil alone could lead to bears being crushed in their dens as 90,000-pound earthquake-inducing thumper trucks cause the bears' snow caves to collapse.
Don't let polar bears die for Big Oil's profits. Support legislation to keep these bears safe!

The Polar Bear Cub Survival Act, if passed, would create a buffer banning oil development around polar bear maternal denning habitat on the Arctic Refuge's coastal plain to ensure denning mothers and cubs are protected.
Congress needs to do what the Trump administration won't. They need to protect one of the most imperiled polar bear populations in the world from dangerous plans to industrialize their critical denning habitat.
Thank you in advance for your dedication to protecting wildlife.

Sincerely,
[Name]

[Company]

Subject: Join the Fight to Save Polar Bears before it's Too Late!

Dear [Recipient Name],

As a member of the University of Sheffield, you have the power to make a real difference in the fight to save polar bears from extinction.

Polar bears are facing an unprecedented crisis as their Arctic habitat melts away due to climate change. The loss of sea ice is making it increasingly difficult for them to find food and reproduce, putting their very survival at risk.

That's where you come in. Our team of dedicated researchers and conservationists at the University of Sheffield is working tirelessly to find ways to protect polar bears and their habitat. But we can't do it alone.

You have the power to make a difference. By joining our Polar Bears Rescue campaign, you can help us raise awareness of the urgent need to protect these magnificent creatures and their fragile ecosystem.

Your support can provide vital funding for our research, conservation efforts, and advocacy work. Together, we can make a real impact and help ensure that polar bears have a future in this changing world.

So, what are you waiting for? Join us today and become a hero for polar bears.

Together, we can make a difference.

Subject: Save Our Planet's Tiniest Inhabitants - Join the Coral Reef Conservation Project!

Dear [Recipient Name],

As a valued member of the University of Sheffield, you have the unique opportunity to contribute to a crucial cause - the preservation of our world's coral reefs.

Corals are the rainforests of the sea, providing a home and sustenance for an abundance of marine life. However, with overfishing, pollution, and climate change, these vital ecosystems are under threat - and fast.

The reefs are bleaching at an alarming rate, meaning they are losing their vibrant colors and, with them, their vitality. This not only impacts the marine life that depends on them but also the thousands of people who rely on these reefs for their source of food, income, and coastal protection.

But there is hope. The University of Sheffield has embarked on a pioneering coral reef conservation project, aiming to restore and protect these essential habitats through innovative research and collaborations with local communities and governments.

By supporting our Coral Reef Conservation Project, you will be joining a global network of individuals and organizations dedicated to preserving our planet's natural beauty and biodiversity.

Your contribution can help us fund research, implement conservation strategies, and spread awareness about the importance of coral reefs. With your help, we can make a real difference in ensuring that these precious ecosystems continue to thrive for generations to come.

Together, we can protect the future of our coral reefs and the life they support. Please join us in this vital mission by donating to or volunteering for our Coral Reef Conservation Project today.

Thank you for your unwavering support and commitment to a better, more sustainable world.

Sincerely,
